_88SpatialExtentType.description: Specifies the geographic and vertical (altitude, depth) coverage of the data.

___SpatialCoverageType.description: Denotes whether the collection's spatial coverage requires horizontal, vertical, horizontal and vertical, orbit, or vertical and orbit in the spatial domain and coordinate system definitions.

$eref.description: Orbit parameters for the collection used by the Orbital Backtrack Algorithm.

___InclinationAngle.description: Inclination of the orbit. This is the same as (180-declination) and also the same as the highest latitude achieved by the satellite. Data Unit: Degree.

___SwathWidth.description: Width of the swath at the equator in Kilometers.

___StartCircularLatitude.description: The latitude start of the orbit relative to the equator. This is used by the backtrack search algorithm to treat the orbit as if it starts from the specified latitude. This is optional and will default to 0 if not specified.

$eref.description: Information about a collection with horizontal spatial coverage.

___ZoneIdentifier.description: The appropriate numeric or alpha code used to identify the various zones in the collection's grid coordinate system.

___Type.description: Describes the type of the area of vertical space covered by the collection locality.

___Value.description: Describes the extent of the area of vertical space covered by the collection. Must be accompanied by an Altitude Encoding Method description. The datatype for this attribute is the value of the attribute VerticalSpatialDomainType. The unit for this attribute is the value of either DepthDistanceUnits or AltitudeDistanceUnits.

$eref.description: The latitude value of a spatially referenced point, in degrees.  Latitude values range from -90 to 90.
The longitude value of a spatially referenced point, in degrees.  Longitude values range from -180 to 180.
The latitude value of a spatially referenced point, in degrees.  Latitude values range from -90 to 90.
The longitude and latitude values of a spatially referenced point in degrees.
The longitude value of a spatially referenced point, in degrees.  Longitude values range from -180 to 180.

_88AbstractType.description: A brief description of the collection. This allows potential users to determine if the collection is useful for their needs.

_88DoiType.description: This element describes the digital object identifier.

$eref.description: The Authority (who created it or owns it) of a unique identifier.

___Authority.description: The authority who created the DOI.

___ContactInformation.description: This is the contact information of the data contact.

$eref.description: Defines the contact information of a data center or data contact.

___RelatedUrls.description: A URL associated with the contact, e.g., the home page for the DAAC which is responsible for the collection.

___ContactInstruction.description: Supplemental instructions on how or when to contact the responsible party.

___ServiceHours.description: Time period when the contact answers questions or provides services.

$eref.description: A Level 3 UUID, see wiki link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier#Version_4_.28random.29

___GroupName.description: This is the contact group name.

___Roles.description: This is the roles of the data contact.

$eref.description: Defines the possible values of a data contact role.

___NonDataCenterAffiliation.description: This is the contact person or group that is not affiliated with the data centers.

_88DataContactRoleEnum.description: Defines the possible values of a data contact role.

_88AuthorityType.description: The Authority (who created it or owns it) of a unique identifier.

_88RelatedUrlType.description: Represents Internet sites that contain information related to the data, as well as related Internet sites such as project home pages, related data archives/servers, metadata extensions, online software packages, web mapping services, and calibration/validation data.

$eref.description: A title type that defines the min and max lengths of all titles.

___Title.description: The Title is a one-line description of the resource, could be used a caption when a browse image is displayed. The title is especially useful for images such as graphs and photos.

___Description.description: Description of the web page at this URL.

___Relation.description: An array of keywords describing the relation of the online resource to this resource.

___MimeType.description: The mime type of files downloaded from this site (e.g., pdf, doc, zip, tiff, jpg, readme).

$eref.description: Represents a data file size.

___Unit.description: Unit of information, together with Size determines total size in bytes of the data.

___FileSize.description: The estimated or average size of a file downloaded from this site.

___URLs.description: The URL for the relevant web page (e.g., the URL of the responsible organization's home page, the URL of the collection landing page, the URL of the download site for the collection).

___Type.description: Describes the type of the area of vertical space covered by the collection locality.

___Value.description: Describes the extent of the area of vertical space covered by the collection. Must be accompanied by an Altitude Encoding Method description. The datatype for this attribute is the value of the attribute VerticalSpatialDomainType. The unit for this attribute is the value of either DepthDistanceUnits or AltitudeDistanceUnits.

_88AddressType.description: This entity contains the physical address details for the contact.

___StateProvince.description: The state or province portion of the physical address.

___Country.description: The country of the physical address.

___StreetAddresses.description: An address line for the street address, used for mailing or physical addresses of organizations or individuals who serve as contacts for the collection.

___PostalCode.description: The zip or other postal code portion of the physical address.

___City.description: The city portion of the physical address.

_88DataCenterRoleEnum.description: Defines the possible values of a data center role.

$eref.description: The longitude and latitude values of a spatially referenced point in degrees.
The longitude and latitude values of a spatially referenced point in degrees.

_88InstrumentType.description: Information about the device used to measure or record data in this collection, including direct human observation. In cases where instruments have a single sensor or the instrument and sensor are used synonymously (e.g. AVHRR), both Instrument and Sensor should be recorded. The Sensor information is represented in a separate section.

$eref.description: The expanded or long name related to the short name of the platform.
The unique name of the platform.
Information about the collection source/sensor configuration, including sensor parameters settings such as technique etc.

___Characteristics.description: Sensor-specific characteristics, e.g,. Wavelength, SwathWidth, Field of View.   The characteristic names must be unique on this sensor; however the names do not have to be unique across sensors.

___Technique.description: Technique applied for this sensor in the configuration.

___Characteristics.description: Instrument-specific characteristics, e.g., Wavelength, SwathWidth, Field of View. The characteristic names must be unique on this instrument; however the names do not have to be unique across instruments.

$eref.description: This entity is used to define characteristics.

___Name.description: The name of the characteristic attribute.

___Value.description: The value of the Characteristic attribute.

___Unit.description: Units associated with the Characteristic attribute value.

___OperationalModes.description: The operation mode applied on the instrument when acquiring the granule data.

___Technique.description: The expanded name of the primary sensory instrument. (e.g. Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflective Radiometer, Clouds and the Earth's Radiant Energy System, Human Observation).

___NumberOfSensors.description: Number of sensors used on the instrument when acquiring the granule data.

$eref.description: The longitude and latitude values of a spatially referenced point in degrees.

_88TilingIdentificationSystemType.description: Information about a two-dimensional tiling system related to this collection.

$eref.description: Defines the minimum and maximum value for one dimension of a two dimensional coordinate system.
Defines the minimum and maximum value for one dimension of a two dimensional coordinate system.

_88OrbitParametersType.description: Orbit parameters for the collection used by the Orbital Backtrack Algorithm.

___InclinationAngle.description: Inclination of the orbit. This is the same as (180-declination) and also the same as the highest latitude achieved by the satellite. Data Unit: Degree.

___SwathWidth.description: Width of the swath at the equator in Kilometers.

___StartCircularLatitude.description: The latitude start of the orbit relative to the equator. This is used by the backtrack search algorithm to treat the orbit as if it starts from the specified latitude. This is optional and will default to 0 if not specified.

_88AccessConstraintsType.description: Information about any constraints for accessing the data set. This includes any special restrictions, legal prerequisites, limitations and/or warnings on obtaining the data set.

___Description.description: Free-text description of the constraint.  In DIF, this field is called Access_Constraint.   In ECHO, this field is called RestrictionComment.  Examples of text in this field are Public, In-house, Limited.  Additional detailed instructions on how to access the collection data may be entered in this field.

___Value.description: Numeric value that is used with Access Control Language (ACLs) to restrict access to this collection.  For example, a provider might specify a collection level ACL that hides all collections with a value element set to 15.   In ECHO, this field is called RestrictionFlag.  This field does not exist in DIF.

_88PeriodicDateTimeType.description: Information about Periodic Date Time collections, including the name of the temporal period in addition to the start and end dates, duration unit and value, and cycle duration unit and value.

___EndDate.description: The date (day and time) of the end occurrence of this regularly occurring period which is relevant to the collection coverage.

___Name.description: The name given to the recurring time period. e.g. 'spring - north hemi.'

___PeriodCycleDurationUnit.description: The unit specification of the period cycle duration.

___StartDate.description: The date (day and time) of the first occurrence of this regularly occurring period which is relevant to the collection coverage.

___DurationValue.description: The number of PeriodDurationUnits in the RegularPeriodic period. e.g. the RegularPeriodic event 'Spring-North Hemi' might have a PeriodDurationUnit='MONTH' PeriodDurationValue='3' PeriodCycleDurationUnit='YEAR' PeriodCycleDurationValue='1' indicating that Spring-North Hemi lasts for 3 months and has a cycle duration of 1 year. The unit for the attribute is the value of the attribute PeriodDurationValue.

___DurationUnit.description: The unit specification for the period duration.

_88HorizontalSpatialDomainType.description: Information about a collection with horizontal spatial coverage.

___ZoneIdentifier.description: The appropriate numeric or alpha code used to identify the various zones in the collection's grid coordinate system.

_88AdditionalAttributeType.description: Additional unique attributes of the collection, beyond those defined in the UMM model, which the data provider deems useful for end-user understanding of the data in the collection.  Additional attributes are also called Product Specific Attributes (PSAs) or non-core attributes.  Examples are HORIZONTALTILENUMBER, VERTICALTILENUMBER.

___ValueAccuracyExplanation.description: Describes the method used for determining the parameter value accuracy that is given for this additional attribute.

$eref.description: This entity contains the additional attribute data types.

___DataType.description: Data type of the values of the additional attribute.

___ParameterValueAccuracy.description: An estimate of the accuracy of the values of the additional attribute. For example, for AVHRR: Measurement error or precision-measurement error or precision of a data product parameter. This can be specified in percent or the unit with which the parameter is measured.

___Description.description: Free-text description of the additional attribute.

___Value.description: Value of the additional attribute if it is the same for all granules across the collection.  If the value of the additional attribute may differ by granule, leave this collection-level value blank.

___UpdateDate.description: The date this additional attribute information was updated.

___MeasurementResolution.description: The smallest unit increment to which the additional attribute value is measured.

___Group.description: Identifies a namespace for the additional attribute name.

___ParameterRangeBegin.description: The minimum value of the additional attribute over the whole collection.

___ParameterUnitsOfMeasure.description: The standard unit of measurement for the additional attribute.  For example, meters, hertz.

___ParameterRangeEnd.description: The maximum value of the additional attribute over the whole collection.

_88PlatformType.description: Describes the relevant platforms used to acquire the data in the collection. Platform type vocabulary is controlled and includes Spacecraft, Aircraft, Vessel, Buoy, Platform, Station, Network, Human, etc.

$eref.description: The expanded or long name related to the short name of the platform.
The unique name of the platform.

___Characteristics.description: Platform-specific characteristics, e.g., Equator Crossing Time, Inclination Angle, Orbital Period. The characteristic names must be unique on this platform; however the names do not have to be unique across platforms.

$eref.description: This entity is used to define characteristics.

___Name.description: The name of the characteristic attribute.

___Value.description: The value of the Characteristic attribute.

___Unit.description: Units associated with the Characteristic attribute value.

$eref.description: Information about the device used to measure or record data in this collection, including direct human observation. In cases where instruments have a single sensor or the instrument and sensor are used synonymously (e.g. AVHRR), both Instrument and Sensor should be recorded. The Sensor information is represented in a separate section.

___Characteristics.description: Instrument-specific characteristics, e.g., Wavelength, SwathWidth, Field of View. The characteristic names must be unique on this instrument; however the names do not have to be unique across instruments.

___OperationalModes.description: The operation mode applied on the instrument when acquiring the granule data.

___Technique.description: The expanded name of the primary sensory instrument. (e.g. Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflective Radiometer, Clouds and the Earth's Radiant Energy System, Human Observation).

___NumberOfSensors.description: Number of sensors used on the instrument when acquiring the granule data.

_88MetadataAssociationType.description: Used to identify other services, collections, visualizations, granules, and other metadata types and resources that are associated with or dependent on the this collection, including parent-child relationships.

___Description.description: Free-text description of the association between this collection record and the target metadata record.

$eref.description: The set of supported values for MetadataAssociationType.Type.

___Type.description: The type of association between this collection metadata record and the target metadata record.   Choose type from the drop-down list.

$eref.description: The version of the metadata record.

___Version.description: The version of the target metadata record that is associated with this collection record.

$eref.description: This is the ID of the metadata record.  It is only unique when combined with the version.

___EntryId.description: Shortname of the target metadata record that is associated with this collection record.

_88EntryIdType.description: This is the ID of the metadata record.  It is only unique when combined with the version.

_88TilingCoordinateType.description: Defines the minimum and maximum value for one dimension of a two dimensional coordinate system.

_88RangeDateTimeType.description: Stores the start and end date/time of a collection.

___BeginningDateTime.description: The time when the temporal coverage period being described began.

___EndingDateTime.description: The time when the temporal coverage period being described ended.

_88LongitudeType.description: The longitude value of a spatially referenced point, in degrees.  Longitude values range from -180 to 180.

_88PointType.description: The longitude and latitude values of a spatially referenced point in degrees.

The longitude value of a spatially referenced point, in degrees.  Longitude values range from -180 to 180.

___Value.description: This is the contact phone number, email address, Facebook address, or Twitter handle associated with the contact method.

___RelatedUrls.description: A URL associated with the contact, e.g., the home page for the DAAC which is responsible for the collection.

It does not refer to the language used in the metadata record (although this may be the same language). The name of the language used for this field is defined in ISO 639.

_88MetadataAssociateTypeEnum.description: The set of supported values for MetadataAssociationType.Type.

$eref.description: A boundary is set of points connected by straight lines representing a polygon on the earth. It takes a minimum of three points to make a boundary. Points must be specified in counter-clockwise order and closed (the first and last vertices are the same).
The longitude and latitude values of a spatially referenced point in degrees.
Contains the excluded boundaries from the GPolygon.

_88BoundaryType.description: A boundary is set of points connected by straight lines representing a polygon on the earth. It takes a minimum of three points to make a boundary. Points must be specified in counter-clockwise order and closed (the first and last vertices are the same).

$eref.description: The longitude and latitude values of a spatially referenced point in degrees.

_88DateType.description: Specifies the date and its type.

$eref.description: The name of supported lineage date types

___Type.description: This is the type of event associated with the date.  For example, Creation, Last Revision.  Type is chosen from a picklist.

___Date.description: This is the date that an event associated with the collection or its metadata occurred.

_88ContactMechanismType.description: Method for contacting the data contact. A contact can be available via phone, email, Facebook, or Twitter.

$eref.description: Defines the possible contact mechanism types.

___Type.description: This is the method type for contacting the responsible party - phone, email, Facebook, or Twitter.

___Value.description: This is the contact phone number, email address, Facebook address, or Twitter handle associated with the contact method.

_88ScienceKeywordType.description: Enables specification of Earth science keywords related to the collection.  The Earth Science keywords are chosen from a controlled keyword hierarchy maintained in the Keyword Management System (KMS).

_88CharacteristicType.description: This entity is used to define characteristics.

___Name.description: The name of the characteristic attribute.

___Value.description: The value of the Characteristic attribute.

___Unit.description: Units associated with the Characteristic attribute value.

_88ResourceCitationType.description: Building block text fields used to construct the recommended language for citing the collection in professional scientific literature.  The citation language constructed from these fields references the collection itself, and is not designed for listing bibliographic references of scientific research articles arising from search results. A list of references related to the research results should be in the Publication Reference element. A DOI that specifically identifies the collection is listed here.

___SeriesName.description: The name of the data series, or aggregate data of which the data is a part.

___ReleaseDate.description: The date when the collection was made available for release.

___Creator.description: The name of the organization(s) or individual(s) with primary intellectual responsibility for the collection's development.

___DataPresentationForm.description: The mode in which the data are represented, e.g. atlas, image, profile, text, etc.

$eref.description: A title type that defines the min and max lengths of all titles.

___Title.description: The title of the collection; this is the same as the collection Entry Title.

___IssueIdentification.description: The volume or issue number of the publication (if applicable).

___ReleasePlace.description: The name of the city (and state or province and country if needed) where the collection was made available for release.

$eref.description: Represents Internet sites that contain information related to the data, as well as related Internet sites such as project home pages, related data archives/servers, metadata extensions, online software packages, web mapping services, and calibration/validation data.

___MimeType.description: The mime type of files downloaded from this site (e.g., pdf, doc, zip, tiff, jpg, readme).

___FileSize.description: The estimated or average size of a file downloaded from this site.

___URLs.description: The URL for the relevant web page (e.g., the URL of the responsible organization's home page, the URL of the collection landing page, the URL of the download site for the collection).

___RelatedUrl.description: The URL of the landing page for the collection.

___Editor.description: The individual(s) responsible for changing the data in the collection.

$eref.description: The version of the metadata record.
This element describes the digital object identifier.

___Authority.description: The authority who created the DOI.

___DOI.description: The Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the collection.  This is the registered DOI that resolves to a landing page for the collection.

___Publisher.description: The name of the individual or organization that made the collection available for release.

_88QualityType.description: Free-text information about the quality of the data in the collection or any quality assurance procedures followed in producing the data described in the metadata. Suggestions for information to include in the Quality field: Description should be succinct. Include indicators of data quality or quality flags. Include recognized or potential problems with quality. Established quality control mechanisms should be included. Established quantitative quality measurements should be included.

_88ContactMechanismTypeEnum.description: Defines the possible contact mechanism types.

_88LongNameType.description: The expanded or long name related to the short name.

___ServiceHours.description: Time period when the contact answers questions or provides services.

___Roles.description: This is the roles of the data contact.

___NonDataCenterAffiliation.description: This is the contact person or group that is not affiliated with the data centers.

_88EntryTitleType.description: The title of the data described by the metadata.

_88ProjectType.description: Information describing the scientific endeavor(s) with which the collection is associated. Scientific endeavors include campaigns, projects, interdisciplinary science investigations, missions, field experiments, etc.

___Campaigns.description: The name of the campaign/experiment (e.g. Global climate observing system).

___LongName.description: The expanded name of the campaign/experiment (e.g. Global climate observing system).

___EndDate.description: The ending data of the campaign.

___ShortName.description: The unique identifier by which a project or campaign/experiment is known. The campain/project is the scientific endeavor associated with the acquisition of the collection. Collections may be associated with multiple campaigns.

___StartDate.description: The starting date of the campaign.

_88UuidType.description: A Level 3 UUID, see wiki link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier#Version_4_.28random.29

_88UseConstraintsType.description: Free-text information about how the data may or may not be used after access is granted to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property. This includes any special restrictions, legal prerequisites, terms and conditions, and/or limitations on using the data set. Data providers may request acknowledgement of the data from users and claim no responsibility for quality and completeness of data.

_88LatitudeType.description: The latitude value of a spatially referenced point, in degrees.  Latitude values range from -90 to 90.

_88TemporalExtentType.description: Information which describes the temporal range or extent of a specific collection.

___EndsAtPresentFlag.description: Setting the Ends At Present Flag to 'True' indicates that a data collection which covers, temporally, a discontinuous range, currently ends at the present date.  Setting the Ends at Present flag to 'True' eliminates the need to continuously update the Range Ending Time for collections where granules are continuously being added to the collection inventory.

___PrecisionOfSeconds.description: The precision (position in number of places to right of decimal point) of seconds used in measurement.

___TemporalRangeType.description: This attribute tells the system and ultimately the end user how temporal coverage is specified for the collection.  Choices are Single Date Time, Range Date Time, and Periodic Date Time.

___RangeDateTimes.description: Stores the start and end date/time of a collection.

$eref.description: Stores the start and end date/time of a collection.

___BeginningDateTime.description: The time when the temporal coverage period being described began.

___EndingDateTime.description: The time when the temporal coverage period being described ended.

___PeriodicDateTimes.description: Temporal information about a collection having granules collected at a regularly occurring period.   Information includes the start and end dates of the period, duration unit and value, and cycle duration unit and value.

$eref.description: Information about Periodic Date Time collections, including the name of the temporal period in addition to the start and end dates, duration unit and value, and cycle duration unit and value.

___EndDate.description: The date (day and time) of the end occurrence of this regularly occurring period which is relevant to the collection coverage.

___Name.description: The name given to the recurring time period. e.g. 'spring - north hemi.'

___PeriodCycleDurationUnit.description: The unit specification of the period cycle duration.

___StartDate.description: The date (day and time) of the first occurrence of this regularly occurring period which is relevant to the collection coverage.

___DurationValue.description: The number of PeriodDurationUnits in the RegularPeriodic period. e.g. the RegularPeriodic event 'Spring-North Hemi' might have a PeriodDurationUnit='MONTH' PeriodDurationValue='3' PeriodCycleDurationUnit='YEAR' PeriodCycleDurationValue='1' indicating that Spring-North Hemi lasts for 3 months and has a cycle duration of 1 year. The unit for the attribute is the value of the attribute PeriodDurationValue.

___DurationUnit.description: The unit specification for the period duration.

_88DistributionType.description: Describes media options, size, data format, and fees involved in distributing or accessing the data.

___Fees.description: The fee for ordering the collection data.  The fee is entered as a number, in US Dollars.

___DistributionMedia.description: The distribution media for the collection data.

___DistributionFormat.description: The distribution format of the collection data (e.g., HDF, netCDF).

___Sizes.description: A list of file sizes indicating a single exact or approximate, or range of distribution sizes.

$eref.description: Represents a data file size.

___Unit.description: Unit of information, together with Size determines total size in bytes of the data.

_88ExclusiveZoneType.description: Contains the excluded boundaries from the GPolygon.

$eref.description: A boundary is set of points connected by straight lines representing a polygon on the earth. It takes a minimum of three points to make a boundary. Points must be specified in counter-clockwise order and closed (the first and last vertices are the same).

_88PurposeType.description: Describes the purpose and/or intended use of data in this collection.

___Unit.description: Unit of information, together with Size determines total size in bytes of the data.

_88TitleType.description: A title type that defines the min and max lengths of all titles.

_88PublicationReferenceType.description: Describes key bibliographic citations pertaining to the data.

___ReportNumber.description: The report number of the publication.

___OtherReferenceDetails.description: Additional free-text reference information about the publication.

___PublicationPlace.description: The pubication place of the publication.

$eref.description: A title type that defines the min and max lengths of all titles.

___Title.description: The title of the publication in the bibliographic citation.

___Pages.description: The publication pages that are relevant.

$eref.description: Represents Internet sites that contain information related to the data, as well as related Internet sites such as project home pages, related data archives/servers, metadata extensions, online software packages, web mapping services, and calibration/validation data.

___Title.description: The Title is a one-line description of the resource, could be used a caption when a browse image is displayed. The title is especially useful for images such as graphs and photos.

___Description.description: Description of the web page at this URL.

___Relation.description: An array of keywords describing the relation of the online resource to this resource.

___MimeType.description: The mime type of files downloaded from this site (e.g., pdf, doc, zip, tiff, jpg, readme).

___FileSize.description: The estimated or average size of a file downloaded from this site.

___URLs.description: The URL for the relevant web page (e.g., the URL of the responsible organization's home page, the URL of the collection landing page, the URL of the download site for the collection).

___RelatedUrl.description: The URL of the website related to the bibliographic citation.

$eref.description: This element describes the digital object identifier.

___Authority.description: The authority who created the DOI.

___DOI.description: The Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of the publication.

___Series.description: The name of the series of the publication.

_88PlatformShortNameType.description: The unique name of the platform.

_88PlatformLongNameType.description: The expanded or long name related to the short name of the platform.
